title: Warriors sign Scottie Pippen's 6-foot-10 nephew to bulk up frontcourt
text:
CLOSE

Kavion Pippen was not even 2 years old when his Hall of Fame uncle won his last NBA championship with the Chicago Bulls.

Now the nephew of Scottie Pippen will get his own shot in the league with a team that knows a thing or two about championships.

The Golden State Warriors signed 6-foot-10 Kavion Pippen to a non-guaranteed deal on Monday to help bulk up their frontcourt with big men Kevon Looney and Willie Cauley-Stein currently sidelined.

The 22-year-old will also be coached by one of his uncle's former teammates, Steve Kerr. Pippen went undrafted after finishing his career at Southern Illinois, where he averaged 12.8 points and 5.6 rebounds a game for the Salukis in 2018-19.

It'd be a long shot for Pippen, a third-team All-Missouri Valley Conference member last year, to make the final Warriors roster after preseason concludes, with Looney (hamstring), Caley-Stein (foot strain) and second-round pick Alen Smailagic (ankle) expected to be healthy soon.

Pippen is from Harrisburg, Arkansas, and played for Three Rivers Community College (Missouri.) before elevating to Division I at Southern Illinois. Scottie Pippen played for Central Arkansas before his Hall of Fame career with the Bulls as Michael Jordan's sidekick.
description: The Warriors signed the nephew of Scottie Pippen, Kavion, to provide help in their frontcourt. He is 6-foot-10 and has never played in the NBA.
